text:

options.C: The minister may be dropped for failing to complete a number of projects

explanation:

text: The word in capital letter has the emphatic stress. choose the option in which the given sentence relates. My mother bought a BICYCLE yesterday.

options.A: When did my mother buy a bicycle?
options.B: What did my mother buy yesterday?
options.C: Whose mother bought a bicycle yesterday?
options.D: Did my mother steal a bicycle yesterday?

explanation:
In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer. Option B doesnt have the emphasized word which makes it the correct option
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letter has the emphatic stress. choose the option in which the given sentence relates.
AMINA went to Abuja by air.

options.A: Did Amina go to Jos by air?
options.B: Is Amina going to Abuja by air?
options.C: Who went to Abuja by air?
options.D: Did Amina go to Abuja by road?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is used to clarify information given or asked in the question. In this case, the appropriate question for the response AMINA went to Abuja by car is "Who went to Abuja by car?". Amina is emphasised because the writer wants to know who went to Abuja by car.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letter has the emphatic stress. choose the option in which the given sentence relates.
Musa is STAYING in Enugu.

options.C: Is Musa staying on the outskirt of Enugu?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or syllable in an utterance. This is done for emphasis or clarification. In this case, emphatic stress is placed on "staying" in the utterance to clarify an error that was made in the question. This means that the question that should be selected should be one that contains a word or phrase that contrasts with "staying" while everything else remains the same. This is why "Is Musa going through Enugu" is the answer to this question.
Is Musa going through Enugu?
No. Musa is STAYING in Enugu.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is true according to the passage?

options.A: Snakes are seldom seen at the Antarctica.
options.B: Snakes are not in the polar regions.
options.C: Snakes are endemic on every continent.
options.D: There are countless number of snakes in the Republic of Ireland.

explanation:
Let’s revisit the relevant part of the passage:
"They are found on every continent except Antarctica... The only places without snakes are parts of the polar regions and isolated islands, such as the Republic of Ireland and New Zealand..."
So, according to the passage:
Snakes areabsentfromAntarctica(which is part of thepolar regions).They are alsonot foundin someisolated islandsandparts of the polar regions.
